bill.title: Recreational vehicles; regulate relationship between manufacturers and dealers of.
bill.description: An Act To Prohibit Manufacturers Or Distributors Of Recreational Vehicles From Selling Recreational Vehicles In This State Without First Entering Into A Manufacturer-dealer Agreement With A Dealer; To Provide For The Designation Of The Area Of Sales Responsibility Exclusively Assigned To A Dealer; To Provide For The Termination, Cancellation, Nonrenewal And Alteration Of A Dealership By A Manufacturer Or Distributor; To Provide For Repurchase Of Inventory By A Manufacturer Upon Termination Of A Manufacturer-dealer Agreement Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For Transfer Of Ownership Of Dealerships; To Specify Warranty Obligations; To Provide For Indemnification Of The Parties To The Agreement Under Certain Circumstances; To Provide For The Repair Of Recreational Vehicles Damaged In Transit To The Dealer And Rejection By A Dealer Of Recreational Vehicles Damaged In Transit Under Certain Circumstances; To Prohibit Coercion Of A Dealer To Purchase Products The Dealer Did Not Order And To Prohibit Coercion Of A Dealer To Enter Into Certain Agreements; To Provide For Mediation Of Disputes; To Regulate The Selling Of Recreational Vehicles At Shows; To Amend Sections 63-17-73, 63-17-111 And 63-17-131, Mississippi Code Of 1972, In Conformity Thereto; And For Related Purposes.
